The discovery of penicillin by Alexander Fleming in 1928. If I could change this event, I would make Fleming discover a more potent and versatile antibiotic that could cure a wide range of bacterial infections. This would have accelerated the development of modern medicine, saving countless lives and reducing the suffering of millions of people worldwide.

The construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza. I would make the ancient Egyptians build a sustainable and eco-friendly pyramid that harnesses renewable energy and minimizes its environmental impact. This would have set a precedent for environmentally conscious architecture and engineering, potentially altering the course of human history.

The invention of the printing press by Johannes Gutenberg in 1440. I would make Gutenberg invent a 3D printing press that can create complex structures and objects with unprecedented speed and accuracy. This would have revolutionized the field of manufacturing, enabling rapid production of goods and transforming the global economy.

The first landing on the moon by NASA's Apollo 11 mission in 1969. I would make the astronauts bring back a sample of lunar water ice, which could have been used to establish a sustainable human presence on the moon. This would have paved the way for a lunar colony, potentially serving as a stepping stone for further space exploration and colonization.

The development of the internet by Vint Cerf and Bob Kahn in the 1970s. I would make them create a decentralized, blockchain-based internet that prioritizes user privacy and security. This would have prevented the widespread surveillance and data exploitation that we see today, potentially altering the course of global politics and society.
